Intervention: Patients receive radiotherapy and healing touch therapy from a healing-touch therapist once a week for the duration of their radiotherapy
Patients receive radiotherapy and sham healing touch therapy from a sham healing-touch therapist once a week for the duration of their radiotherapy
Eligibility: Receiving post lumpectomy or post mastectomy radiation therapy (RT)
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status of 0, 1 or 2
Prescribed a minimum of 5 weeks of RT
Documented cognitive impairment that would preclude the ability to provide informed consent.
Results: Fatigue Using the Brief Fatigue Inventory (BFI)

9-items with an 11-point rating scale measures intensity of fatigue (3 items, 0 = no fatigue to 10 = fatigue as bad as you can imagine) and interference of fatigue on daily life (6 items, 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes. Each participant's score is summed with a possible minimum score of 0 and a possible maximum score of 90. A mean score was then determined.
Arm/Group Description: Patients receive radiotherapy and healing touch therapy from a healing-touch therapist once a week for the duration of their radiotherapy
Unit of Measure: units on a scale  2.786         (0.1963)
Arm/Group Description: Patients receive radiotherapy and sham healing touch therapy from a sham healing-touch therapist once a week for the duration of their radiotherapy
Unit of Measure: units on a scale  1.356         (0.1413)
